page.title: 02Road & Rail Communications
page.content: The railway line from Tunbridge Wells crosses the area from NW to SE,joining the line from Bexhill to Hastings after W.St.Leonard's station.The coastal line enters the Bopeep Tunnel E of the junction.It is electrified but the line towards Tunbridge Wells is not.Rail journeys to London take about 105 mins. The main roads are the A259 coast road the A2036 joining it at Pebsham,and part of the A21 from London at Silverhill.Other important links from the N of the town to the coast road are Harley Shute Rd./Ironlatch Ave.; Filsham Rd.;Maze Hill/The Green/ Sedlescombe Rd.S.The busiest spot is Silverhill Crossroads but traffic jams often occur at the bottom of Harley Shute Rd.because of heavy E-W traffic on the A259.Most people think a town by-pass is needed.
